result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Court orders Defendant to go to JusticePoint today, get an assessment and follow treatment recommendations.

3:19 PM Defendant Casey J Schoenrock in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Casey J Schoenrock.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Matter is set for a waived preliminary hearing today.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

Filed by Prosecutor. Date: September 26, 2022 at 1:15 pm, Branch 2.
Agency Case No.: C22-09933

1:56 PM Defendant Casey J Schoenrock appeared by video.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Methamphetamine and Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond and states reasons on the record.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Comply with all bond conditions in his open cases.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Comply with Day Reporting
